description.original: Ein ICD-10-, Alpha-ID-, SNOMED-, Orpha- oder anderer Code, der die Diagnose identifiziert.

translations.value: Ein ICD-10-, Alpha-ID-, SNOMED-, Orpha- oder anderer Code, der die Diagnose identifiziert.
An ICD-10-, Alpha-ID-, SNOMED-, Orpha- or other code that identifies the diagnosis.

description.original: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.
A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
Ein Verweis auf einen von SNOMED CT definierten Code

translations.value: Ein Verweis auf einen von SNOMED CT definierten Code
A reference to a code defined by SNOMED CT

description.original: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).
The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured, and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.
A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - e.g. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).

description.original: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).
The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

Bie Verwendung von ICD-10-GM ist die Angabe der Version zwingend erforderlich.
Hierdurch wird der Tatsache Rechnung getragen, dass jede der jährlich neu erscheinenden Fassung von ICD-10-GM ein neues Codesystem darstellt.

Zusätzliche Informationen zur Diagnose als Freitext.

translations.value: Zusätzliche Informationen zur Diagnose als Freitext.
Additional information about the diagnosis as free text.

description.original: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.
The kind of staging, such as pathological or clinical staging.
A simple summary of the stage such as "Stage 3". The determination of the stage is disease-specific.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
A category assigned to the condition.
A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.
Die Körperstelle der Diagnose mittels SNOMED oder anderem Code.

translations.value: Körperstelle der Diagnose mittels SNOMED oder anderem Code.
The body site of the diagnosis using SNOMED or other systems.

Geschätztes oder tatsächliches Datum oder Zeitraum, an dem die Erkrankung begonnen hat, nach Meinung des Klinikers.

translations.value: Geschätztes oder tatsächliches Datum oder Zeitraum, an dem die Erkrankung begonnen hat, nach Meinung des Klinikers.
Estimated or actual date or date-time the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

description.original: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).
Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).
Supporting evidence / manifestations that are the basis of the Condition's verification status, such as evidence that confirmed or refuted the condition.
A manifestation or symptom that led to the recording of this condition.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
Business identifiers assigned to this condition by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.
Datum, an dem die Diagnose erstmals dokumentiert wurde.

translations.value: Datum, an dem die Diagnose erstmals dokumentiert wurde.
Date when the diagnosis was first recorded.

description.original: aktiv | Rezidiv | Rückfall | inaktiv | Remission | abgeklungen

active | recurrence | relapse | inactive | remission | resolved
